column5: A Protestant Christian is a member of any number of sects of contemporary Western Christianity whose faith and practice developed out of the 16TH century Protestant Reformation in Europe. They hold the Bible to be the sole source of revelation; they believe in justification by faith alone#Comma and in the universal priesthood of all believers in the divinity of Jesus.#Newline<think><set name="it"><set name="topic">PROTESTANT CHRISTIAN</set></set></think>
A protestant is a Christian who rejects the central authority of the Catholic or Orthodox church.

A religion and philosophic system of central and eastern Asia#Comma founded in India in the 6th century B.C. by Buddha. It teaches that right thinking and self-denial will enable the soul to reach Nirvana#Comma a divine state of release from misdirected desire.

A system of religious belief. Belief in a divine or superhuman power or powers to be obeyed and worshipped as the creator(s) and ruler(s) of the universe. Any system of beliefs#Comma practices#Comma ethical values#Comma etc. resembling#Comma suggestive of#Comma or likened to such a system.
The study of religious doctrines and matters of divinity; specifically#Comma the study of God and the relations between God#Comma mankind#Comma and the universe.
The power or practices of witches; black magic; sorcery.
